summary: Texture update of the Dragonscale Armor converting it to black and grey.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-2.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/61320-3-1420309817.jpg[/img]

[b]Description[/b]
This mod is a simple texture edit that converts the Dragonscale Armor to black and grey for both male and female armors.

I never liked the ivory color of the Dragonscale Armor. This mod takes the Bethesda HD DLC Textures and converts them to black and grey. The process I used gives them a sort of a scorched look which goes nicely with the idea of dragon fighting.

Just a texture edit. No .eps required. Save game safe.

[size=3]NEXUS EXCLUSIVE. FREE.
If you see this mod somewhere else, I did not put it there nor did I give permission to put it there. [/size]

[b]Files Edited[/b]
data\textures\armor\dragonscale\armor.dds
data\textures\armor\dragonscale\armorf.dds
data\textures\armor\dragonscale\boots.dds
data\textures\armor\dragonscale\gloves.dds
data\textures\armor\dragonscale\helmet.dds
data\textures\armor\dragonscale\shield.dds

[b]Process[/b]
[list=1][*]Extracted the textures from the BSA.[/*]
[*]Opened them in PS with the nVidia plugin. Added a BW layer set to High Contract Blue Filter.[/*]
[*]Flattened the layers.[/*]
[*]Ran a contrast mask on it to sharpen it up a bit.[/*]
[*]Saved.[/*]
[*]Ran them through TES_Optimizer.[/*]
[*]Saved.[/*]
[/list]
[b]Install[/b]
Use a Mod Manager. I use NMM.

[b]Uninstall[/b]
Use same mod manager you used to install.

[b]Manual[/b]
If you do a manual install be sure to back up your original textures if you want to restore them.

There are no ESP files. The mod is just an edit of the Bethesda Hi-Res DLC textures.

[b]Permissions[/b]
It's just a quick Photoshop edit of the Bethesda Hi-Res DLC texture. Do with it as you will.
